intro: Guettarda sabiceoides, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of yellow, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds covered in a hairy coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its showy blooms. The species is also valued for its ability to tolerate coastal conditions and its role in supporting local wildlife.
